title: Expand post-game OutroFlow with additional narrative blocks and interactive takeaways popups

requirements.text: Update the existing first outro text block to add a third revealed line after the current two lines: "That can't be it..." and require a visible Continue button to proceed to the next outro block (matching the existing line-by-line reveal + gated progression behavior used in OutroFlow).
acceptanceCriteria: After game completion, the outro first block displays the existing two lines, then reveals the new third line "That can't be it..." using the same timed line-by-line reveal behavior as other outro lines.
A Continue button is shown for the user to advance only after the first block content is revealed (consistent with existing OutroFlow gating).
Clicking Continue transitions to the next outro block with the same animation/styling conventions used elsewhere in OutroFlow.

requirements.text: Add a new second outro block (after the first block’s Continue) that reveals the provided multi-line text line-by-line, and then requires a Continue button to proceed to the next block.

acceptanceCriteria: The second block appears only after the user clicks Continue on the first block.
The second block reveals each of the provided lines in order using the same timed line-by-line reveal pattern as the current OutroFlow.
After the final line is revealed, a Continue button is available to advance to the next block.
All text matches the user-provided wording, punctuation, and capitalization exactly.

requirements.text: Add a new third outro block (after the second block’s Continue) that displays a 7-item takeaways list where each item is underlined and uses a pointer cursor; clicking any item opens a popup/modal containing placeholder lorem ipsum text and a link to https://lmt.lv.

quotes:

acceptanceCriteria: After the user clicks Continue on the second block, the 7-item list is shown with each item underlined and the cursor changes to pointer on hover.
Clicking any list item opens a popup/modal (in-app overlay) containing placeholder lorem ipsum text and a clickable link pointing to exactly https://lmt.lv.
The popup/modal can be closed and the user returns to the same list state (no navigation away from the outro).
All 7 list item labels match the user-provided text exactly.

requirements.text: Keep the expanded outro fully integrated into the existing post-game flow: the game-to-outro transition remains the same, and the outro continues to use the existing OutroFlow styling conventions (background gradient, typography, button style, and reveal animations) without introducing new navigation paths.

quotes: All of this should reuse the existing OutroFlow stage system, line-by-line reveals, Continue gating, and popup styling patterns already in the app.

acceptanceCriteria: Collecting the 7th unique collectible and closing the final pickup modal still transitions into the outro as it does today.
The expanded outro runs in the new order: (1) first block with added line + Continue, (2) new multi-line block + Continue, (3) clickable takeaways list with popups.
Visual presentation matches existing OutroFlow patterns (same background treatment and CTA button style) and does not regress intro/game visuals.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; compose and reuse existing UI components instead.
Do not modify frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (Internet Identity/actor hooks and frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend must remain single-actor; no new backend work is required for this change.
nonGoals: Do not change any gameplay mechanics, collectible logic, or the condition that triggers the outro after the 7th unique collectible.
Do not finalize or customize the popup content beyond placeholder lorem ipsum and the provided https://lmt.lv link.
Do not introduce new authentication flows or any backend API dependencies for the outro content.
